Item Rate Type Camp Sites without Electric $20 plus tax Daily Camp Sites without Electric $350 plus tax Monthly Camp Sites with Electric $25 plus tax Daily Camp Sites with Electric $450 plus tax Monthly Extra Person $2 plus tax Daily Extra Person $10 plus tax Weekly Extra Person $25 plus tax Monthly Picnic Shelters (not reserved) Free Picnic Shelters (reserved) $50 plus tax Daily Pavilion $250 plus tax $150 refundable deposit required Daily Nickerson/Ulrich Building $450 plus tax $250 refundable deposit required Daily Real-Time Weather Data To view real time weather at Pioneer Park visit http://hardee.weatherstem.com/fswnzolfosprings Park Rules In order to make your stay more pleasant, we invite your attention to the following Park Rules. Pioneer Park is owned and operated by County Government. Therefore, all camping units must display a current tag, readily visible to management. No reservations. Camp in designated sites only . One camping unit & one vehicle allowed per campsite. Camping unit and/or RV must be kept clean and in a good state of repair, which includes: Clean; free of dirt, mold, and mildew. Tarps will only be allowed for 14 days during construction/repair. All campers/RVs entering Pioneer Park must be in good condition. All body work must be clean and in good repair. The camper/RV must be free from damage, rust, mold, and dirt. All awnings and equipment must be well maintained without any visible damage. No ropes or wires shall be attached to trees or buildings. Doormat shall be no larger than 3’x 4’. All trash must be placed in garbage cans or dumpsters provided. Dump station is located at the west end of the park. No water is allowed to be dumped on the ground. (washing of vehicles, trailers, or motor homes is prohibited) No boards, pallets, blocks, or other such items on the grass. All items outside on camp site will be arranged in a neat and orderly fashion. Camp fires are allowed, but please be careful. All camp sites must be left clean & neat upon departure. Restrooms with showers are available to registered campers. Showers are available to non-campers for a $2.00 fee per shower to be paid at the park Office. Children are the responsibility of the parent/guardian at all times. Pets (two per camp site) are welcome, but must be on a leash (not to exceed ten feet) at all times. Pets are not allowed inside park buildings or near the Wildlife Refuge area. Do not leave pets unattended. Pet disturbance will NOT be tolerated at any time. ALL PET WASTE MUST BE CLEANED UP BY THE PET OWNER! No swimming in any waters of the park. Fishing is allowed from the banks of Pioneer Lake, Rock Lake, & Peace River. Boats are allowed on Peace River only. Boat ramp is available. Quiet time in the park is between the hours of 10:00 pm until 8:00 am. Please be respectful of other campers. Park management reserves the right to ask any camper to vacate the park premises at any time, for any reason, including but not limited to violations of park rules, disruptive behavior, safety concerns, or any actions that may negatively impact the experience or well-being of other guests. Compliance with all park regulations is expected to ensure a safe and enjoyable environment for all visitors. From a few rough cages located around the perimeter of Pioneer Park to a model Refuge, dreams became reality when we relocated to our new facility in 2001. Today the Refuge is home to native Florida wildlife and a few exotic species, each housed in natural-type habitats. Coming from various walks of life, each animal has been placed in our care with their own unique story . However, they do have one thing in common – they needed a forever home and could not survive in the wild. Now they are thriving in their refuge home, which provides nutritional food, shelter, and large physical areas for enrichment activity. Guests are encouraged to visit the Refuge and take a stroll among the tree tops on the elevated boardwalk and become educated about the animals that make the Hardee County Wildlife Refuge their home. There are 3 restrooms located throughout the park. The restrooms in the camping areas also have shower facilities available. There are also picnic areas, a picnic pavilion, and a playground available . The park includes a boardwalk that winds around the lakes and through the woods, with an observation tower where people can watch wildlife. The fisheries are controlled by the Florida Game and Fish Commission, and fishing is allowed in all the lakes. Hardee Lakes Park contains 4 lakes in total ; Lake Hardee is 120 acres, Deer Lake is 110 acres, Lake Firefly is 97 acres, and Gator Lake is 47 acres. Before you arrive at Hardee Lakes Park, please review the Hardee Lakes Golf Cart UTV Policy , Rules, and Regulations of Hardee Lakes, or a brochure that contains the fishing regulations and a summary of the park rules. Each item is maintained either within glass-enclosed cases or strategically placed around the museum floor. Many of the larger items are provided in a setting that would be reminiscent of pioneer living. The items are identified with a tag that not only gives its description but includes the name of the person who donated it. Proper records are maintained, so at any time, a guest may inquire about a certain item donated by a family member and its location can be retrieved through its computer database. This procedure is used many times within a month to assist family members in viewing a loved one’s acquisition.
